Articles.Content:
well thats depressing;.;

Wonder how long till video

Hit the barge, but too hard for survival

https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/588076749562318849
Too bad... Always next time thought
Must have timed the suicide burn too late...

Ascent successful. Dragon enroute to Space Station. Rocket landed on droneship, but too hard for survival.

Source - Musk's Twitter

aaaaaaargh..... The expletives I'm uttering right now...

but it was a landing! that in and of itself is good news!
Suicide burns can be tricky
On the bright side, at least they know how to get to there target. Haha
Now we have to see that video. If it at least crashed upright then that's progress!
But it hit the barge.

well thats depressing;.;

That's data. They can consistently hit it, just need to go a little slower next time

Now we have to see that video. If it at least crashed upright then that's progress!

Exactly what I was thinking.
I feel bad, but I hope the barge came out fine.
When is the next opportunity?

Aww well good that it landed, in some form. that is certainly still a milestone, still a first. I had this ready for success: http://cdn2.sbnation.com/imported_assets/2106015/stephen-colbert-celebration-gif.gif

That's data. They can consistently hit it, just need to go a little slower next time

Same thought here. I'm highly optimistic. They might miss a few more times, but they'll get it. It's just engineering tweeks by now.
Darn Kerbal Engineer, never can trust its suicide burn calculations...

Ascent successful. Dragon enroute to Space Station. Rocket landed on droneship, but too hard for survival.

3,758 retweets 2,252 favorites -elon musk

Dang, well with the accuracy proven, perhaps the FAA will allow them to do land-based attempts in the future.
Great launch SpaceX! I hope you guys were left with more pieces to play with this time

Now we have to see that video. If it at least crashed upright then that's progress!
Exactly what I was thinking.

By the wording of his tweet, "Rocked landed on droneship, but too hard for survival", I infer it did?

When is the next opportunity?

The end of the webcast said there is a sat launch later this month, but I have no idea if the orbit allows landing or not. Anybody heard?
I don't think the Turk sat allows for a landing attempt, think the inclination is wrong.

By the wording of his tweet, "Rocked landed on droneship, but too hard for survival", I infer it did?

Maybe it landed but broke landing legs/engines
Gotta love that one quote I just read from spacex, "we falcon punched the barge."
Do you think he'll ever tweet "The Falcon has landed", or is that too cheesy??

Dang, well with the accuracy proven, perhaps the FAA will allow them to do land-based attempts in the future.

Is there a launch site that would allow this, with a meaningful goal orbit and safety margins along the way? The first stage goes pretty far from what I've seen.
